In three sentences
Comments
I am never worried while on campus! Being 4'11, safety was a big concern for me. At USD I feel right at home.
Clubs and activities are available for any interest or personality.
USD is the perfect school for anyone looking for that big university feel in a small town. I love the exciting atmosphere with the small size.
Movies at the MUC Activities held weekly by different clubs Bowling Sporting events Department held speakers Dance Marathon Strollers Many more!
There are a lot of different choices, but the choices don't change daily. However, the taste is great!
Something every college student has to experience! Many great memories take place in the dorms, and the friends you make will last a lifetime.
Academics at USD can be as easy or as challenging as you want!

Tips for students looking into The University of South Dakota: 1. Manage your time, there are so many great opportunities at the University of South Dakota, but keeping those grades up is your most important job as a student 2. Live in the dorms during your freshman year to experience what many know as dorm life 3. Get involved 4. Try new things

The University of South Dakota has a very welcoming and friendly environment from the moment you step foot on campus. The entire staff is very helpful while guiding students on their path to whatever lies ahead of them, and the opportunities available to students while attending USD are limitless. Overall, I have been very satisfied with USD and would recommend it to anyone looking to go to school there.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students For those students who are interested in The University of South Dakota, I would advise coming to visit campus. This is really the only way to see how great the campus is and how much students and faculty members can interact with one another. After being here for a little while and getting to know people, campus has really started to become like home for me, and it definitely feels like one big family. Bang for the buck The University of South Dakota is rated one of the best schools for it's value almost every year. Because I was not interested in any of the colleges that were in my state, USD was a great choice for me. I am paying the same, if not less, to go here than I would have at a university in my home state. Also, the amount of financial aid available to students is relatively generous. Am enjoying being here Vermillion is known for being a small town that is home to a big university. With the amount of students that are enrolled at USD being approximately 10,000 and the number of permanent residents of Vermillion being a similar number, the town is definitely centered around the campus and its students.
